act_info.full_title: Aliens' Real Property Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. A.18
act_info.citation: Aliens' Real Property Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. A.18

content.section: Aliens’ powers as to real estate
content.content: 1. Every alien has the same capacity to take by gift, conveyance, descent, devise, or otherwise, and to hold, possess, enjoy, claim, recover, convey, devise, impart and transmit real estate in Ontario as a natural born or a naturalized subject of Her Majesty. R.S.O. 1990, c. A.18, s. 1.
content.raw_html: 1. Every alien has the same capacity to take by gift, conveyance, descent, devise, or otherwise, and to hold, possess, enjoy, claim, recover, convey, devise, impart and transmit real estate in Ontario as a natural born or a naturalized subject of Her Majesty. R.S.O. 1990, c. A.18, s. 1.

content.section: Descent of real estate of aliens
content.content: 2. The real estate in Ontario of an alien dying intestate descends and may be transmitted as if it had been the real estate of a natural born or a naturalized subject of Her Majesty. R.S.O. 1990, c. A.18, s. 2. ______________ Français
content.raw_html:
2. The real estate in Ontario of an alien dying intestate descends and may be transmitted as if it had been the real estate of a natural born or a naturalized subject of Her Majesty. R.S.O. 1990, c. A.18, s. 2.

______________
